intro: Oenanthe anatolica, commonly known as Anatolian hemlock, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Turkey and parts of the Middle East. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments, often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Oenanthe anatolica is also noted for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
